TP53.name: TP53
TP53.fact: TP53 is called the 'guardian of the genome'.

BRCA1.name: BRCA1
BRCA1.fact: Mutations in BRCA1 raise risk of breast and ovarian cancer.

BRCA2.name: BRCA2
BRCA2.fact: BRCA2 also contributes to breast cancer susceptibility.

EGFR.name: EGFR
EGFR.fact: EGFR mutations are common in lung cancer.

MYC.name: MYC
MYC.fact: MYC regulates cell growth and proliferation.

PTEN.name: PTEN
PTEN.fact: PTEN often loses function in cancers.

AKT1.name: AKT1
AKT1.fact: AKT1 is a key player in cell survival signaling.

NRAS.name: NRAS
NRAS.fact: NRAS is frequently mutated in melanoma.

HRAS.name: HRAS
HRAS.fact: HRAS was the first RAS oncogene discovered.

APOE.name: APOE
APOE.fact: APOE ε4 allele is linked to Alzheimer’s disease.

ACE2.name: ACE2
ACE2.fact: ACE2 is the receptor for SARS‑CoV‑2.

FTO.name: FTO
FTO.fact: FTO variants are associated with obesity.

HBB.name: HBB
HBB.fact: Mutations in HBB cause sickle cell disease.

TNF.name: TNF
TNF.fact: TNF plays a central role in inflammation.

IL6.name: IL6
IL6.fact: IL‑6 is involved in immune response and fever.

ESR1.name: ESR1
ESR1.fact: ESR1 encodes the estrogen receptor alpha.

ESR2.name: ESR2
ESR2.fact: ESR2 encodes the estrogen receptor beta.

APP.name: APP
APP.fact: APP processing leads to amyloid beta.

MAPT.name: MAPT
MAPT.fact: MAPT mutations are linked to dementia.

PSEN1.name: PSEN1
PSEN1.fact: PSEN1 mutations are a cause of early-onset Alzheimer’s.

FMR1.name: FMR1
FMR1.fact: FMR1 expansions cause Fragile X syndrome.

HTT.name: HTT
HTT.fact: HTT expansions lead to Huntington's disease.

CFH.name: CFH
CFH.fact: CFH mutations linked to macular degeneration.

CRP.name: CRP
CRP.fact: CRP level is a marker of inflammation.

HLA-A.name: HLA-A
HLA-A.fact: HLA‑A is involved in antigen presentation.

HLA-B.name: HLA-B
HLA-B.fact: HLA‑B has many alleles affecting transplant compatibility.

HLA-C.name: HLA-C
HLA-C.fact: HLA‑C plays a role in immune response.

TNFRSF1A.name: TNFRSF1A
TNFRSF1A.fact: Mutations cause TNF receptor–associated periodic syndrome.

VEGFA.name: VEGFA
VEGFA.fact: VEGF‑A is essential for blood vessel formation.

CFTR2.name: CFTR2
CFTR2.fact: CFTR2 variants are studied in cystic fibrosis.

CACNA1C.name: CACNA1C
CACNA1C.fact: CACNA1C variants associate with cardiac arrhythmia.

RYR2.name: RYR2
RYR2.fact: RYR2 mutations cause heart rhythm disorders.

DMD.name: DMD
DMD.fact: DMD gene is the largest human gene.

ALDH2.name: ALDH2
ALDH2.fact: ALDH2 variant causes alcohol flush reaction.

CYP2D6.name: CYP2D6
CYP2D6.fact: CYP2D6 varies widely in drug metabolism rates.

TPM1.name: TPM1
TPM1.fact: TPM1 is important in muscle contraction.

ACTB.name: ACTB
ACTB.fact: ACTB encodes beta‑actin, a cytoskeletal component.

MT-CO1.name: MT-CO1
MT-CO1.fact: MT-CO1 encodes cytochrome c oxidase subunit I.

MT-ND4.name: MT-ND4
MT-ND4.fact: MT-ND4 is part of mitochondrial complex I.

GBA.name: GBA
GBA.fact: GBA mutations increase Parkinson’s disease risk.

LRRK2.name: LRRK2
LRRK2.fact: LRRK2 is most common genetic cause of Parkinson’s.
